content:
It sounds like you've got a good memory of your recent purchases. Let's organize the information you've shared:

**Amazon Order 1:**

* Date: Last week (exact date not specified)
* Item: Pair of sneakers
* Discount: 20% off with coupon code
* Total Cost: Not specified

**Amazon Order 2:**

* Date: Last week (exact date not specified)
* Item: Wireless charging pad
* Discount: 20% off with coupon code (assuming same discount as Order 1)
* Total Cost: Not specified

**ASOS Order:**

* Date: Last week (exact date not specified)
* Items: Dress and pair of earrings (birthday gift for sister)
* Total Cost: Not specified

To get a better picture of your spending, it would be helpful to know the exact dates and total costs for each order. You can try checking your email for the order confirmations or log in to your Amazon and ASOS accounts to find the information.

Once you have the exact dates and costs, you can add them to your list and get a clearer understanding of your spending from last week.

Remember, tracking your spending is an important step in managing your finances and making informed purchasing decisions. Keep up the good work!
